intro: Dicrastylis archeri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thornplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters. Dicrastylis archeri is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
